title: Tassel, 17th century
medium:
Medium: linen
Technique: braided and knotted, with bobbin lace
creditline: Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf
description: Long linen tassel, braided and knotted, with bobbin lace. Loop attached to long cord, terminating in pear-shaped unit which is completely covered with tiny knottings and from which are suspended six long design elements of tiny knots alternating with bobbin lace medallions, floral petals, and leaves.

exhibitions.title: The Cooper-Hewitt Collections: A Design Resource

tombstone.epitaph:
Tassel, 17th century.
17th century. Medium: linen
Technique: braided and knotted, with bobbin lace. Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf. 1962-51-28.
